timeline.message:
Removing the min and the max shard calculations. (#220)

* Removing the min and the max shard calculations while inserting shards in a Zone

Instead while returning the shard list as part of the REST request, we sort
shards by the temperature value for the dimension.

* making it more obvious that this is reverse sorted

timeline.bodyText: can we follow the same naming convention and remove "In_BYTES" from the name of the metric
timeline.author: rguo-aws

+

+public class ShardSize extends Metric {

timeline.bodyText: Can you remove these changes ? These are from a different commit
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: This commit got merged while rebasing from the master. I have certain other commits on top of it and also the files modified by both the commits are same. So I will have to revert the commit file by file. Is it possible to ignore these changes while reviewing?  I will take care in other PRs.
replies.author: aditjind

timeline.bodyText: Can we name it something else ? There are too many shards in the name here :)
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: Why do we not need the totalBytes over all shards ?
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: I was calculating the total bytes by multiplying the average shard size by the total number of shards. But we can do that calculation while fetching from the DB itself. Updated this in the latest commits.
replies.author: aditjind

replies.bodyText: Thanks for changing this. Doing that calculation on the SQLite layer is much much faster.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: I guess we can remove this line
timeline.author: rguo-aws

timeline.bodyText: Do we want to throw an exception here if shardsize flowunit is not received ? Can we simple send out an empty flowunit if some upstream flowunits are missing ?
timeline.author: rguo-aws

replies.bodyText: That would mean we are calculating the RCA with half knowledge of metrics and calculating shard heat based on that. We are going to trigger shard movement going forward with these and this should only be done when we have full knowledge of the metrics.
replies.author: aditjind

replies.bodyText:
Throwing an exception is dangerous as this will mute the node and exclude it from future runs. We should not throw an exception inside operate unless it is an un-recoverable exception.
But here we check for size to be one as this is intra-node aggregation and we don't expect multiple FlowUnits to show up just one and to @rguo-aws 's point, that can be an empty one.
replies.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: Right missed the point about muting the node. Added the empty flow unit in case no flow units are received. We are returning from NodeTemperatureRCA in the case of these empty flow units.
replies.author: aditjind

timeline.message:
Because of a race during merging changes into master, we introduced a… (#226)

* Because of a race during merging changes into master, we introduced a merge conflict that will fail the build

* Removing the parameter marker in the LOG

Adding the Shard Size in the Temperature Profile RCA

Updated the UTs
Retained a Copy of the same file During Merge. Removing
Adding support for Running RCA on Nodes which are not dedicated masters.

Updating the RCA Conf Files

Disabling the Shard Size based Temperature RCA by default because the Shard
Size RCA needs per shard node stats metric which is disabled by default

timeline.bodyText:
Fro every new dimension we add, we have to add 4 new graph nodes that translates into multiple Java classes. It would be nice if we can merge them so that adding a new dimension is as simple as adding a new metric to a set that would be much cleaner.
This refactoring can be part of a separate PR. Just wanted to bring this up.
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: At some point we should move them to the rca.conf as dynamic configs.
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.message: Emitting Empty Flow Unit in case of No flow units received
